intro: Relbunium diffusum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth relbunium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. This variety is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in grassy habitats. It plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
